timeline.bodyText: If the connector is not one that the Guided Rule Model supports, this defaults to predicate.
timeline.author: Rikkola

timeline.bodyText: Separated this method so it can be overwritten.
timeline.author: Rikkola

timeline.bodyText: This fix is not only needed by this, but fixes the behaviour for GRE and BRL condition columns in GDST.
timeline.author: Rikkola

timeline.bodyText:

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't we implement as return new EvalExpr(expr).asFieldConstraint(m, factPattern); ?
Asking because that EvalExpr seems be implemented exactly in same way.
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: @jomarko Well spotted. Works and less redundancy.
replies.author: Rikkola

timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: This and several more DRL snippets will fail. What we support should probably be limited to what the Guider Rule Editor components can produce, and like in this case, what we want to be able to migrate from XLS to GDST.
replies.author: Rikkola

timeline.bodyText: If a boolean is expected as param1 value, shouldn't this line be rather         singleFieldConstraint.setValue("(age != null) == @{param1}"); ?
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: I would keep it with quotes. The GRE components tend to add the quotes since they rely on the fact that MVEL is used.
